meanings.definition: The upward bending of plant parts in response to environmental stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The hyponasty of the leaves helped the plant receive more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The hyponasty of the flower petals made them face towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The hyponasty of the vines seemed like they were reaching for a hug from the sun.
meanings.sent4: The hyponasty of the branches created a natural archway in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The hyponasty of the stem was like a graceful bow to the morning light.

meanings.definition: The movement of plant parts in which the upper surface grows faster than the lower surface, causing the part to bend upward.
meanings.sent1: The hyponasty of the leaves was due to differential growth rates.
meanings.sent2: The hyponasty of the stem allowed the plant to reach for the sky.
meanings.sent3: The hyponasty of the petals made the flower look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The hyponasty of the branches gave the tree a unique shape.
meanings.sent5: The hyponasty of the vine was like a slow, elegant stretch towards the sun.
